# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/idna/idnadata.py
@source-hash: 76a470cadce48c81
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:58:54Z

## IDNA Data Module

**Primary Purpose:** Automatically generated Unicode data tables for Internationalized Domain Names in Applications (IDNA) processing, specifically for handling international domain name validation and normalization.

**Key Data Structures:**

### Version and Metadata
- `__version__` (L3): String literal '15.1.0' indicating IDNA data version
- Auto-generation header comment (L1) indicates this is generated by tools/idna-data

### Unicode Script Mappings
- `scripts` (L4-102): Dictionary mapping Unicode script names to tuples of hexadecimal ranges
  - Contains major scripts: 'Greek' (L5-42), 'Han' (L43-66), 'Hebrew' (L67-77), 'Hiragana' (L78-85), 'Katakana' (L86-101)
  - Each script maps to tuple of packed 64-bit integers representing Unicode code point ranges
  - Format: 0xSTARTEND where START and END are concatenated hex values

### Arabic/Bidirectional Text Processing
- `joining_types` (L103-3028): Large dictionary mapping Unicode code points to joining behavior constants
  - Maps individual code points (hex keys) to numeric joining type values
  - Common values: 84 (Transparent), 82 (Right_Joining), 68 (Dual_Joining), 67 (Join_Causing), 76 (Left_Joining)
  - Critical for Arabic, Hebrew, and other right-to-left script rendering
  - Covers extensive Unicode ranges including Arabic (0x620-0x6FF), Hebrew (0x590-0x5FF), and many extended blocks

### IDNA Character Classification
- `codepoint_classes` (L3029-4245): Dictionary defining character validity classes for IDNA processing
  - 'PVALID' (L3030-4233): Massive tuple of ranges for characters valid in domain names
  - 'CONTEXTJ' (L4234-4236): Context-dependent joining characters (ZWJ/ZWNJ)
  - 'CONTEXTO' (L4237-4244): Context-dependent other characters (middle dot, Arabic-Indic digits, etc.)

**Architecture Patterns:**
- Packed range encoding: Uses concatenated start/end values in single integers for memory efficiency
- Flat lookup tables: Direct hash-based lookups for O(1) character classification
- Unicode block organization: Data organized by Unicode script and functional categories

**Critical Dependencies:**
- Part of pip's vendored IDNA library for domain name validation
- Used by internationalization systems for proper Unicode text handling
- Essential for web applications handling non-ASCII domain names

**Performance Considerations:**
- Large static data (>4000 lines) loaded at import time
- Memory-intensive but optimized for lookup speed
- Read-only reference data with no runtime modifications
